hooks.prompt: Check if the file being written contains any hardcoded secrets, API keys, passwords, or tokens (anything matching patterns like sk-*, AIza*, ghp_*, xoxb-*, or generic password/secret assignments). If secrets are found, respond with BLOCK and explain which secret was detected. If no secrets found, respond with ALLOW. Input: $ARGUMENTS

hooks.command: file_path=$(echo "$TOOL_INPUT" | jq -r '.file_path // empty'); if echo "$file_path" | grep -q "$HOME/dotfiles/"; then cd "$HOME/dotfiles" && git add -- "$file_path" && git diff --cached --quiet || git commit -m "auto: update $(echo "$file_path" | sed "s|$HOME/dotfiles/||")"; fi

file_path=$(echo "$TOOL_INPUT" | jq -r '.file_path // empty'); if echo "$file_path" | grep -q "$HOME/dotfiles/"; then cd "$HOME/dotfiles" && git add -- "$file_path" && git diff --cached --quiet || git commit -m "auto: update $(echo "$file_path" | sed "s|$HOME/dotfiles/||")"; fi
exit_code=$(echo "$TOOL_RESULT" | jq -r '.exitCode // 0'); if [ "$exit_code" != "0" ]; then echo '[hook] Command exited with non-zero status'; fi
cd "$HOME/dotfiles" && git pull --rebase --autostash 2>/dev/null || echo '[dotfiles] pull failed — may need manual merge'

cd "$HOME/dotfiles" && git add -A && { git diff --cached --quiet || git commit -m 'auto: session end sync'; } && git pull --rebase --autostash 2>/dev/null && git push 2>/dev/null || echo '[dotfiles] sync failed — will retry next session'
